pullRequest.title: Updates to Readmes
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR covers required readme updates.
CS repo issue 2166


Animate Images with Image Overlay (Scene)
This was to update the 'How it works' section. However reviewing the common designs, Java was already a bit different before these additional changes, so have left as is for now. But would appreciate this being checked as not sure if there's a reason it was different in the first place. Can update to match the design if not.


Feature Layer Shapefile (feature layers)
Updated How to Use section


Token Authentication (portal)
Added Additional information section


CS repo issue 2155


Feature Layer Selection (feature layers)
Reordering of 2 sections done


List Transformations by suitability (geometry)
In this case I added in the entire Additional information section from the common samples repo, including the recent update from the Issue. Again I can amend this if it is supposed to be different for Java or there's back story that I'm not aware of.

nodes.bodyText:
Should this be Z-aware? Not sure when you capitalise.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            This sample uses a `GeographicTransformation`, which extends the `DatumTransformation` class. As of 100.9, ArcGIS Runtime also includes a `HorizontalVerticalTransformation`, which also extends `DatumTransformation`. The `HorizontalVerticalTrasnformation` class is used to transform coordinates of z-aware geometries between spatial references that have different geographic and/or vertical coordinate systems.
          
          
            
            This sample uses a `GeographicTransformation`, which extends the `DatumTransformation` class. As of 100.9, ArcGIS Runtime also includes a `HorizontalVerticalTransformation`, which also extends `DatumTransformation`. The `HorizontalVerticalTrasnformation` class is used to transform coordinates of Z-aware geometries between spatial references that have different geographic and/or vertical coordinate systems.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -27,6 +27,22 @@ If the selected transformation is not usable (has missing grid files) then an er
 * GeometryEngine
 * TransformationCatalog
 
+## Additional information
+
+Some transformations aren't available until transformation data is provided.
+
+This sample uses a `GeographicTransformation`, which extends the `DatumTransformation` class. As of 100.9, ArcGIS Runtime also includes a `HorizontalVerticalTransformation`, which also extends `DatumTransformation`. The `HorizontalVerticalTrasnformation` class is used to transform coordinates of z-aware geometries between spatial references that have different geographic and/or vertical coordinate systems.

nodes.bodyText:
It looks like in our sample we don't use the GeographicTransformation class: just the DatumTransformation class. Whenever I do a ReadMe update which contains new classes, I always do a quick "Find..." within the sample just to sanity check if we use the class from the generic sample description or not: samples can vary slightly between SDKs and also in name, so it's a good habit to get into!
What is the purpose of the addition of this additional information here: is it intended that this sample use the HorizontalVerticalTransformation? Does the code require updating? If not then we can just reword to avoid specifically saying that our samples uses the GeographicTransformation: but you should probably double check the wording with the author of the common sample readme to be sure this still delivers the message intended.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            This sample uses a `GeographicTransformation`, which extends the `DatumTransformation` class. As of 100.9, ArcGIS Runtime also includes a `HorizontalVerticalTransformation`, which also extends `DatumTransformation`. The `HorizontalVerticalTrasnformation` class is used to transform coordinates of z-aware geometries between spatial references that have different geographic and/or vertical coordinate systems.
          
          
            
            As of 100.9, ArcGIS Runtime also includes a `HorizontalVerticalTransformation`, which extends `DatumTransformation`. The `HorizontalVerticalTrasnformation` class is used to transform coordinates of z-aware geometries between spatial references that have different geographic and/or vertical coordinate systems.

nodes.bodyText:
it's possible we need to refine this further for Java: having a look at our TransformationCatalog class, there is guidance there for where the default location for such projection info is:
https://developers.arcgis.com/java/latest/api-reference/reference/com/esri/arcgisruntime/geometry/TransformationCatalog.html#getProjectionEngineDirectory()
Note that it is also possible to set the directory location:
https://developers.arcgis.com/java/latest/api-reference/reference/com/esri/arcgisruntime/geometry/TransformationCatalog.html#setProjectionEngineDirectory(java.lang.String)
in which case we'd need to say something like the following, but I'd like a second opinion from @colinanderson here first please to sanity check what I'm saying!

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            5. Create an `~/ArcGIS/Runtime/Data/PEDataRuntime` directory on your device and copy the files to this directory.
          
          
            
            5. Find the `<application directory>/resources/pedata` directory on your device and copy the files to this directory.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -27,6 +27,22 @@ If the selected transformation is not usable (has missing grid files) then an er
 * GeometryEngine
 * TransformationCatalog
 
+## Additional information
+
+Some transformations aren't available until transformation data is provided.
+
+This sample uses a `GeographicTransformation`, which extends the `DatumTransformation` class. As of 100.9, ArcGIS Runtime also includes a `HorizontalVerticalTransformation`, which also extends `DatumTransformation`. The `HorizontalVerticalTrasnformation` class is used to transform coordinates of z-aware geometries between spatial references that have different geographic and/or vertical coordinate systems.
+
+This sample can be used with or without provisioning projection engine data to your device. If you do not provision data, a limited number of transformations will be available.
+
+To download projection engine data to your device:
+
+1. Login to the [ArcGIS for Developers site](https://developers.arcgis.com/sign-in/) using your Developer account.
+2. In the Dashboard page, click '[Download APIs and SDKs](https://developers.arcgis.com/downloads/data)' and go to the `Supplemental ArcGIS Runtime Data` tab.
+3. Click the download button next to `Projection Engine Data` to download projection engine data to your computer.
+4. Unzip the downloaded data on your computer.
+5. Create an `~/ArcGIS/Runtime/Data/PEDataRuntime` directory on your device and copy the files to this directory.

commit.message: update to transformations by suitability readme
